text.__SUMMARY__: Hypericum abilianum is a shrub in the genus Hypericum, in the section Adenosepalum, known only from one specimen collected in Africa.
text.Description: The species is a subshrub 40 centimeters tall with orange to red stems. It has 3–5 flowers that are each approximately 15 mm in diameter. Its golden yellow petals are 8–10 mm long and 4 mm broad, tinged with red on the upper surfaces.
text.Distribution:
It has only been found in Angola, but no conclusive distribution data has been found. The single cataloged specimen was gathered in the Huíla Province in 1960 by E.J. Mendes.
